physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Mild right hip pain and limitation of motion after spraining; malunion of the right femur neck observed on X-ray; osteoporosis of the pelvis.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Serum calcium level: 3.1 mmol/L (reference values: 2.0 – 2.7 mmol/L); Serum parathyroid hormone level: 1288.0 pg/mL (reference values: 17.3 – 72.9 pg/mL)
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Diagnosis of primary hyperparathyroidism (PHPT) established based on hypercalcemia and elevated parathyroid hormone levels.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: After partial parathyroidectomy, blood calcium level decreased to 2.0 mmol/L and parathyroid hormone level decreased to 304.0 pg/mL, indicating improvement.
